name: C++ Set
description: C++ Sets are containers that store unique elements following a specific order

Iterators.val: Returns an iterator referring to the first element in the set container
Returns an iterator referring to the past-the-end element in the set container
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the last element in the container
Returns a reverse iterator pointing to the theoretical element right before the first element in the set container
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the first element in the container
Returns a const_iterator pointing to the past-the-end element in the container
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the last element in the container
Returns a const_reverse_iterator pointing to the element that would theoretically precede the first element in the container

Capacity.val: Returns whether the set container is empty
Returns the number of elements in the set container
Returns the maximum number of elements that the set container can hold

Modifiers.val: Extends the container by inserting new elements, effectively increasing the container size by the number of elements inserted
Removes from the set container either a single element or a range of elements
Exchanges the content of the container by the content of x, which is another set of the same type
Removes all elements from the set container (which are destroyed), leaving the container with a size of 0
Inserts a new element in the set, if unique
Inserts a new element in the set, if unique, with a hint on the insertion position

Observers.val: Returns whether the set container is empty
Returns the number of elements in the set container
Returns the maximum number of elements that the set container can hold

Operations.val: Extends the container by inserting new elements, effectively increasing the container size by the number of elements inserted
Removes from the set container either a single element or a range of elements
Exchanges the content of the container by the content of x, which is another set of the same type
Removes all elements from the set container (which are destroyed), leaving the container with a size of 0
Inserts a new element in the set, if unique
Inserts a new element in the set, if unique, with a hint on the insertion position

Allocator.val: Returns whether the set container is empty
